intro: Tibouchina holosericea, commonly known as the silver tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant produces showy clusters of pink to violet flowers during the warmer months. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sun. Tibouchina holosericea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
